conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The image shows four openings labeled A, B, C, and D at the top, and three containers labeled E, F, and G at the bottom.
There are slanted baffles of different colors (blue, gray, brown, black) inside the container, directing the flow of liquid.
The baffles are positioned at various angles, creating pathways for the liquid to flow downward.
The container labeled E is yellow, F is brown, and G is blue, matching the colors of some baffles.
Liquid from A will hit the blue baffle and be directed towards container G.
Liquid from B will hit the yellow baffle and be directed towards container E.
Liquid from C will hit the green baffle and then the blue baffle, ultimately being directed towards container G.
Liquid from D will hit the orange baffle and then the brown baffle, ultimately being directed towards container F.
The final prediction is that liquid from A and C will flow into G, liquid from B will flow into E, and liquid from D will flow into F.
